org.smpp

Class OutbindReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.SmppObject
      • org.smpp.util.ProcessingThread
        • org.smpp.ReceiverBase
          • org.smpp.OutbindReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class OutbindReceiver
extends ReceiverBase
    This class is for receiving outbind request from SMSC. It listens on server socket for client connection, if the connection is accepted and created, it reads a PDU on the connection and if it is outbind pdu, it creates an OutbindEvent and passes it to the OutbindEventListener.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team

    • Method Detail

      • tryReceivePDU

        protected PDU tryReceivePDU(Connection connection,
                            PDU expectedPDU)
                     throws UnknownCommandIdException,
                            TimeoutException,
                            PDUException,
                            IOException
        Description copied from class: ReceiverBase
        This method should try to receive one PDU from the connection. It is called in cycle from tryReceivePDUWithTimeout until timeout expires. The method should check if the actualy received PDU is equal to the expectedPDU.
        Specified by:
        tryReceivePDU in class ReceiverBase
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection from which the PDU should be received
        expectedPDU - the command id and sequence id of the received PDU should be equal to those of expectedPDU
        Returns:
        the received PDU if any or null if none received
        Throws:
        UnknownCommandIdException - PDU with unknown id was received
        TimeoutException - rest of data not received for too long time
        PDUException - incorrect format of PDU
        IOException - exception during communication
        See Also:
        ReceiverBase.tryReceivePDUWithTimeout(Connection,PDU,long), ReceiverBase.receiveAsync(), ProcessingThread.run(), PDU.equals(Object)

      • receiveAsync

        protected void receiveAsync()
        Description copied from class: ReceiverBase
        Method repeatedly called from process method. It's expected that derived classes implement atomic receive of one PDU in this method using ReceiverBase's tryReceivePDUWithTimeout and receivePDUFromConnection methods.
        Specified by:
        receiveAsync in class ReceiverBase
        See Also:
        ReceiverBase.tryReceivePDUWithTimeout(Connection,PDU,long), ProcessingThread.process(), ProcessingThread.run()

      • setAcceptTimeout

        public void setAcceptTimeout(long acceptTimeout)
        Sets the timeout for accepting a connection. If the timeout expires, the receiver thread loops and tries to accept the connection again. (Infinite cycles are evil.)

      • setOutbindListener

        public void setOutbindListener(OutbindEventListener listener)
        Sets the listener for receiving the OutbindEvent.

      • getAcceptTimeout

        public long getAcceptTimeout()
        Returns the current setting of the accept timeout.

      • getOutbindListener

        public OutbindEventListener getOutbindListener()
        Returns the current outbind listener.

      • getThreadName

        public String getThreadName()
        Description copied from class: ProcessingThread
        Should return the name for the thread. Derived classes are expected to return specific name here from this method.
        Overrides:
        getThreadName in class ProcessingThread
